title: RADS Error - Could not connect to HTTP server
body:
So today I had just gotten rid of a Trojan infection on my pc, and when I rebooted, league came up with this message-

"Could not connect to the HTTP server. Please check that your internet connection is enabled and that your firewall is not blocking access"

I've been browsing for solution the whole day and so far nothing had come up that actually worked. I've:
-Reinstalled and rebooted (again)
-Changed the IPv4 DNS to 8.8.8.8
-Cleared the RADS Solutions folder and deleted the air client thing from the projects folder
-Taken down firewall
-Changed the systems.cfg file

But nothings worked. I would really appreciate it if anyone could help find a solution.

replies.body: Make sure your firewall is set to allow any league related apps to run. Also try uninstalling league to check if your infection caused errors in riots code

It's possible that your computer may have configured some tougher security settings upon getting rid of that.  Your issue might be due to a permissions setting that's preventing the launcher from loading, and not necessarily a network connection problem.  I would like to rule this out by having you go over our [permissions ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)guide as a first step.  Let me me know the results, or if your issue persists!
It doesn't seem that the permissions are the problem. I've done everything in the guide but still get the RADS error.

Thanks for following up!  No worries, go ahead and [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can investigate this further.  You can also use our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs) to automatically gather a set of logs which will help get some more context.  We'll respond and help out asap!
After toying around with all my programs and uninstalling a bunch of suspicious/ unneeded programs including a few antiviruses, League ran perfectly again!
Thanks for the help! I've submitted a ticket and await a response :-)
